content: I added a FAQ section for https://github.com/rust-lang/compiler-team/issues/409 and it worked so well that I started to think we should just make this a standard part of any MCP. WDYT, @pnkfelix / @Wesley Wiser? (We need a better ping group for this sort of question, I suspect)

Frequently asked questions seems like a bit of a misnomer if this is part of a newly posted proposal. But the content does seem very useful and I don't have a better name for it so :thumbs_up: from me!
Or "Frequently Anticipated questions" :wink:

Wesley Wiser said:

Frequently asked questions seems like a bit of a misnomer if this is part of a newly posted proposal. But the content does seem very useful and I don't have a better name for it so :thumbs_up: from me!

I mean come on
everybody knows most FAQs were never asked:)
that said, I fully expect it to grow as people ask questions
i.e., things that come up in #t-compiler/major changes threads should be added to the FAQ
and the second should only happen when it's all captured there
I fully recognize I was being overly pedantic :smile:
